questions.Question: Which of the following is not a branch of federal form of government?
questions.solution: Solution:		Federal form of government includes Legislative, Executive and Judiciary. India runs a federal form of governance with clear demarcation of powers between its 3 organs.

questions.Question: _____is an institutional mechanism to accommodate two sets of polities  one at the regional level and the other at the national level.
questions.solution: Solution:		Federalism ensures government entities at different level. One at centre, other at state and local government at lowest tier. Federalism delineates the power of government at all levels. The subjects of all three form of government are enumerated in centre list, state list and concurrent list.

questions.Question: The Cabinet is the nucleus of power in
questions.solution: Solution:		Ivor Jennings called the parliamentary system as 'cabinet system' because the cabinet is the nucleus of power in a parliamentary system.

questions.Question: The foremost basic features of the Constitution of India include
questions.optionC: Rule of Law, Principal of Equality
questions.optionD: Judicial Review and Secularism E.  All of the above
questions.solution: Solution:		The foremost basic features of the Constitution of India include Supremacy of the Constitution, Independence of Judiciary, Rule of Law, Principal of Equality, Judicial Review and Secularism.

questions.Question: President of India can be re-elected
questions.solution: Solution:		President of India can be re-elected or any number of terms.

questions.solution: Solution:		Renunciation, Termination and Deprivation.

questions.Question: Vice-President is-
questions.optionD: Not a member of any house
questions.solution: Solution:		 Article-66(2) of Constitution prohibits Vice-President from being a member of either house of Parliament or of State Legislature. But he or she shall be qualified for election as a member of Council of States to become Vice-Presidernt as provided under Article-66(3).

questions.Question: In India, Prime Minister can hold his post till, he has-
questions.solution: Solution:		According to Article-75(3), Council of Ministers headed by Prime Minister shall be collectively responsible to the lower house i.e. Lok Sabha. Collective responsibility here signifies that the existence of Council of Ministers with Prime Minister is only till they enjoy majority or confidence of Lok Sabha.

questions.Question: Who chairs the meeting of Council of Ministers?
questions.solution: Solution:		According to the Article-74, Prime Minister is the head of Council of Ministers. He presides over the meetings of Council of Ministers and decides the agenda and venue of the meeting too.

questions.Question: Who is the Supreme Commander in Chief of Defence Forces of the country?
questions.solution: Solution:		According to the provisions under Article-53(2) President of India is the Supreme Commander in Chief of Defence Forces of Union of India. Defence forces in India include Indian Army, Indian Navy and Indian Air Force.

questions.Question: Who appoints the Attorney General of India?
questions.solution: Solution:		According to the provisions under Article-76, any person who is qualified to be appointed as a Judge of Supreme Court can be appointed as Attomy General of India by President.

questions.Question: The pre-requisite for the enforcement of directive principles of the state policy is
questions.solution: Solution:		The pre-requisite for the enforcement of directive principles of the state policy is adequate resources.

questions.Question: The Objectives Resolution which laid down the main objectives to guide the deliberations of the Assembly was moved by
questions.solution: Solution:		The Objectives Resolution which laid down the main objectives to guide the deliberations of the Assembly was moved by Jawaharlal Nehru.

questions.Question: The president can advance money to meet unforeseen expenses, pending authorization by Parliament, from
questions.solution: Solution:		The president can advance money to meet unforeseen expenses, pending authorization by Parliament, from the Contingency Fund.

questions.Question: The position of a chief minister is
questions.optionA: similar to that of the prime minister
questions.optionB: identical to that of the president
questions.optionC: a combination of the position of the prime minister and president
questions.solution: Solution:		A chief minister is understood to be "first among equals". They would be the chief adviser to the nominal head of their state, the chair of cabinet and leader of the main governing political party in the legislature.

questions.Question: The members of the Rajya Sabha are elected for a term
questions.optionB: determined by the state legislative assembly of a state
questions.solution: Solution:		Rajya Sabha is a permanent body and is not subject to dissolution. However, one third of the members retire every second year, and are replaced by newly elected members. Each member is elected for a term of six years. The Vice President of India is the ex-officio Chairman of Rajya Sabha.

questions.Question: Programme for capacity building of Elected Women Representatives (EWRs)of panchayats has been launched at_____ .
questions.solution: Solution:		Programme for capacity building of elected women representatives of panchayat has been launched at Ranchi, Jharkand. The programme was launched by Ministry of Women & Child Development in collaboration with Ministry of Panchayati Raj. The programme aimed for empowerment and emancipation of women.

questions.Question: Which of the following state had implemented the provision of removal of the elected members of local self-governance institutions-
questions.solution: Solution:		Removal of elected members by the people for ineffective administration and incapacity is called Right to Recall. Madhya Pradesh along with Chhatisgarh and Punjab has implemented this provision in local goverance institutions.

questions.Question: The "Recall Provision" to removethe elected office bearers from the Local Self Government institution has been executed in-
questions.solution: Solution:		Removal of elected members by the people for ineffective administration and incapacity is called Right to Recall. Madhya Pradesh along with Chhatisgarh and Punjab has implemented this provision in local goverance institutions.

questions.Question: Who is the head of Municipal Corporation?
questions.solution: Solution:		The head of Municipal Corporation is Mayor. Municipal corporation and urban local bodies came into effect after 74th amendment in the constitution. Municipal corporation are autonomous bodies aimed to provide civic services like drinking water, sanitation, sewerage etc.

questions.Question: Democratic Decentralization means-
questions.solution: Solution:		The term Domocratic Decentralization itself carries the concepts of Democracy which is active participation of people in decision-making and Decentralization which is transfer of power or authority to grassroot level i.e. central to local government. Thus democratic decentralization signifies that people at grossroot level are at the core of decision making through local government.

questions.Question: What is the total number of members for the main opposition party in parliament-
questions.solution: Solution:		In order to get the recognition as main opposition party in Parliament, the concerned party must have at least 10% or onetenth of total strength of the house (55 seats in Lok Sabha). Recognition of main opposition party can only be given to a single political party and not to the coalition or alliance. At present, there is no recognised opposition party in Lok Sabha, since no party qulifies the 10% criteria.

questions.Question: Parliament and Constitution are not mode of-
questions.solution: Solution:		Indian democratic system was formed with an objective of providing its citizen social, economic andpolitical justice. Preamble of India takes oath to provide justice which is ensured by Directive Principles of State Policy. Therefore Parliament and Constitution are mode of political, economic and social Justice. But the authority to ensure legal justice has been vested in the judiciary in India.

questions.Question: Indian Parliament is-
questions.solution: Solution:		Indian Parliament is bicameral. It consist of 2 housesLok Sabha (House of people) and Rajya Sabha (Council of States). The bicameralism feature of Parliament was introduced in India for the first time in GOI Act, 1919.

questions.Question: The number of parliamentary seats (Lok Sabha) of Kerala is-
questions.solution: Solution:		Kerala, the state with highest literacy rate, has 20 parliamentary seats (Lok Sabha). In Rajya Sabha it has representation of 9 seats.

questions.Question: Which of the following parliamentary constituency is the largest in terms of area-
questions.solution: Solution:		Laddakh in Jammu and Kashmir is the largest parliamentary constituency in India in terms of area which is followedby Barmer in Rajasthan. Whereas Lakshadweep is the smallest parliamentary constituency in terms of area.In terms of number of electors, Malkajgiri in Andhra Pradesh and Lakshadweep are the largest arid smallest Parliament constituencies respectively.

questions.Question: The number of writs that can be prayed for and issued by the Supreme Court and/or a High Court is
questions.solution: Solution:		Anything that is issued under an authority is a writ. Orders, warrants, directions etc. issued under authority are examples of writs. There are five major types of writs viz. habeas corpus, mandamus, prohibition, quo warranto and certiorari. Each of them has different meaning and different implications.In India, both Supreme Court and High Court have been empowered with Writ Jurisdiction. Further, Parliament by law can extend power to issue writs to any other courts (including local courts) for local limits of jurisdiction of such courts.

questions.Question: The minimum age to qualify for election to the Lok Sabha is
questions.solution: Solution:		Article 84 (b) of Constitution of India provides that the minimum age for becoming a candidate for Lok Sabha election shall be 25 years.

questions.Question: The pension of a high court judge is charged to the
questions.optionB: Consolidated Fund of the state where he last served
questions.optionC: Consolidated Funds of the different states where he has served
questions.solution: Solution:		The pension of a high court judge is charged on the consolidated fund of India and not the state. Also, in case of common High Courts (for multiple States/UTs), the salaries and allowances are charged on the consolidated fund of the state in which the seat of the High Court is located.

questions.Question: The preamble says that the state in India will assure the dignity of the individual. The constitution seeks to achieve this object by guaranteeing
questions.optionA: equal fundamental rights to each citizen
questions.optionB: the right to adequate means of livelihood to each individual
questions.optionC: just and humane conditions of work to each individual
questions.optionD: equal wages for equal work to each individual irrespective of sex
questions.solution: Solution:		The preamble says that the state in India will assure the dignity of the individual. The constitution seeks to achieve this object by guaranteeing equal fundamental rights to each citizen.

questions.Question: The minimum age of the voter in India is
questions.solution: Solution:		The Sixty-first Amendment of the Constitution of India, officially known as The Constitution (Sixty-first Amendment) Act, 1988, lowered the voting age of elections to the Lok Sabha and to the Legislative Assemblies of States from 21 years to 18 years. This was done by amending Article 326 of the Constitution, which concerns elections to the Lok Sabha and the Assemblies.

questions.Question: The First Finance Commission was constituted in-

questions.Question: The five permanent members of United Nations Security Council are-
questions.solution: Solution:		The five permanent members of United Nations Security Council are - China, France, Russia, UK, USA.

questions.solution: Solution:		The Government of India prohibits trafficking for commercial sexual exploitation of women through the Immoral Trafficking Prevention Act (ITPA). Prescribed penalty under the ITPA, ranging from seven years to life imprisonment are sufficiently stringent and commensurate with those for other grave crimes.

questions.Question: The total number of judges in International Court of Justice are-
questions.solution: Solution:		The I.C.J. is composed of fifteen judges elected for nine year term by the U.N. General Assembly. It is headquartered in Hague, Netherlands.

questions.Question: Which fundamental right was abolished by the 44th Amendment?
questions.solution: Solution:		Right to property was earlier a fundamental right under the provision of Article-31. But after 44th Constitutional Amendment, 1978, this fundamental right was abolished and it was made a legal right under Artcle-300(A) under Part-XII of constitution.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not a fundamental rights in Indian constitution?

questions.Question: From where did India adopted the federal system with a strong centre?
questions.solution: Solution:		India adopted federal system with a strong center from Canada. Other Provisions adopted from Canada are distribution of powers between union and states, placing residuary powers with centre, and appointment of governer by center.

questions.Question: Which among the following Articles came into force on 26th November 1949, the day the Indian Constitution was adopted?
questions.solution: Solution:		India adopted its constitution on 26th Nov, 1949. Preamble along with some articles was enacted on this day only. These articles are Art. 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 60, 324, 366, 367, 379, 380, 388, 392, and 393.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not a feature of Indian Constituion?
questions.solution: Solution:		India is a country which has parliamentary form of government with federal system of governance that has a feature of Independence of Judiciary. Presidential form of government is a feature of USA and France.

questions.Question: The constitution provides prohibition of traffic in human beings and forced labour under
questions.solution: Solution:		The constitution provides prohibition of traffic in human beings and forced labour under Rights against Exploitation (Article 23).

questions.Question: The committee which was appointed to identify the creamy layer among the OBCs was :
questions.solution: Solution:		The term was introduced by the Sattanathan Commission in 1971, which directed that the "creamy layer" should be excluded from the reservations (quotas) of civil posts. It was also identified later by Justice Ram Nandan Committee in 1993.

questions.Question: Articles 17 abolishes:

questions.Question: Dr. B. R. Ambedkar described Directive Principles of state Policy as :
questions.solution: Solution:		Dr. B. R. Ambedkar described Directive Principles of state Policy as novel features of the constitution.

questions.Question: Which part of Indian constitution is described the Magna Carta of India?
questions.optionA: Part III containing Fundamental Rights (Article 12 to 35)
questions.optionB: Part IV Directive principles of state policy
questions.solution: Solution:		Part III containing Fundamental Rights (Article 12 to 35) is described as the Magna Carta of India.

questions.Question: Which Article of the constitution defines the term state in Indian context?
questions.solution: Solution:		According to Article 12 of the Constitution of India, the term 'State' can be used to denote the union and state governments, the Parliament and state legislatures and all local or other authorities within the territory of India or under the control of the Indian government.

questions.Question: The right to property was deleted from the list of fundamental rights by
questions.solution: Solution:		The 44th Amendment of 1978 removed the right to property from the list of fundamental rights. A new provision, Article 300-A, was added to the constitution, which provided that "no person shall be deprived of his property save by authority of law".

questions.Question: The only state in the Indian union which used to have its own separate state constitution was
questions.solution: Solution:		The Indian government on August 5, 2019 revoked Article 370 which gave special status to Jammu and Kashmir and proposed that the state be bifurcated into two union territories Jammu and Kashmir, and Ladakh.

questions.Question: A person to be eligible for election as president of India should have completed
questions.solution: Solution:		According to Article 58 of the Constitution, no person shall be eligible for election as President unless he is a citizen of India, has completed the age of thirty-five years and is qualified for election as a member of the House of the People.

questions.Question: The Comptroller and Auditor General of India acts as the chief accountant and auditor for the-
questions.solution: Solution:		CAG's (Duties, powers and conditions of service) Act, 1971 has mentioned the duties of CAG. It includes auditing all accounts of Government of India and Government of States. He also acts as chief accountant for the Government of State as he prepares and maintains the accounts of State Government.

questions.Question: Which of the following appointments are not made by President of India?
questions.solution: Solution:		Chief Justice of India, Chief of all the three defence forces in India i.e. Indian Army, Navy and Air Force areappointed by President of India. Whereas Speaker of Lok Sabha is not appointed by President rather he or she is elected by newly constituted Lok Sabha from among its members.

questions.Question: Which of the following appointment is not in the Jurisdiction of President?

questions.Question: How many maximum terms, a person can serve as Prime Minister of India?
questions.solution: Solution:		Constitution does not prescribe any limit with respect to the number of terms a person can serve as Prime Minister of India. A person can remain as Prime Minister till the time Council of Ministers headed by enjoy majority or confidence of Lok Sabha.

questions.Question: What is the retirement age of the Prime Minister of India?
questions.solution: Solution:		Constitution does not prescribe the retirement age of Prime Minister. There is no age limit till he/she can serve as Prime Minister. But there is provision forminimum age of 25 years, if he/she is a member of Lok Sabha and 30 years in case of his/her membership in Rajya Sabha.

questions.Question: The money bill can be presented in the state assembly with prior athorization of-
questions.solution: Solution:		Any bill which consists of provisions of taxation, borrowing of money by government or any financial obligation of government, any transaction from consolidated fund of state or contingency fund of state is termed as money bill under state legislature. It can be introduced only in state legislative assembly with prior approval of Governor that state.

questions.Question: The maximum time a person can continue to be the minister of the State Government without being a member the state legislature-
questions.solution: Solution:		Any minister of state government can continue to be a minister without being a member of state legislature for maximum of six months. After the expiration of six month he or she will cease to be minister.

questions.Question: Article-187 of the Indian constitution "Secretariat of State Legislature" deals with?
questions.optionB: The Directive Principles of State Policy
questions.optionD: The fundamental rights of the Indian Citizen
questions.solution: Solution:		Arbcle-187 of constitution, which is related to chapter of state legislature under Part-VI, deals with subject matters of state government or machinery. As per the provision of this article, each house of legislature of stats shall have a seperate secretarial staff.

questions.Question: The right to move the Supreme Court for the enforcement of fundamental rights including the writs of habeas corpus, mandamus, prohibition, certiorari and quo warranto are the parts of
questions.solution: Solution:		The right to move the Supreme Court for the enforcement of fundamental rights including the writs of habeas corpus, mandamus, prohibition, certiorari and quo warranto are the parts of Right to Constitutional Remedies.

questions.solution: Solution:		The right to acquire, hold and dispose of property was deleted from the chapter of fundamental right by the 44th Constitutional Amendment Act of 1978.

questions.Question: Which Article grants protection to persons who are arrested or detained?
questions.solution: Solution:		Article 22 grants protection to persons who are arrested or detained.

questions.solution: Solution:		The Article 40 which requires the state to organize village panchayats and authority to enable them to function as units of self government is part of Directive Principles of States Policy.

questions.Question: The law which aims at protecting the monuments, places and objects of national importance is
questions.optionC: The Ancient and Historical Monument and Archaeological Sites and Remains Act
questions.solution: Solution:		Article 49 of the constitution casts an obligation on the state to protect every monument or place of object of artistic or historic interest declared by or under law made by parliament to be of national importance from spoliation, disfigurement, destruction, removal, disposal, export, as the case may be.

questions.Question: Which of the following can be amended by special majority?
questions.optionD: Use of English language in Parliament
questions.solution: Solution:		Directive Principles of State Policy contained in Part-IV of the constitution and can only be amended by special majority. DPSP are borrowed from Ireland. questions.Question: During an emergency all of the fol.owing fundamental rights are suspended, except-
questions.solution: Solution:		During the proclamation of emergency under Article-352, all fundamental rights except rights under Article-20 and 21 which deal with protection while conviction for offences and right to life and personal liberty respectively, are suspended.

questions.Question: During emergency imposed under Article-352, which of the following constitutional provisions stands suspended?
questions.solution: Solution:		During the proclamation of National Emergency under Article-352, Fundamental rights of citizens can besuspended. Article-19 is automatically suspended in case of emergency on grounds of war or external aggression whereas all other Fundamental Rights except rights under Article-20 and 21 can be suspended by President through a separate proclamation.

questions.Question: For how much time Financial Emergency can be proclaimed?
questions.solution: Solution:		Financial emergency under Article-360 can remain operational for indefinite period of time until revoked by President. However, President declaration on Financial Emergency need to be approved by Parliament within two months. So far it has not been decleared in India.

disturbances

External emergency caused due to external
threat

constitutional machinery in the state

questions.Question: "Taxes on lands and buildings" is listed in the  ______ list given in the Seventh Schedule in the Constitution of India.

questions.Question: Who proposed the Preamble before the drafting committe of the Constitution?
questions.solution: Solution:		The 'Objective Resolution" proposed by Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru, on 13th December, 1946 and passed by constituent assembly, ultimately became the preamble to the constitution. It sets out main objectives which constituent Assembly intended to achieve.

questions.Question: The largest committee of Parliament of India is-

questions.Question:

questions.solution: Solution:		Financial committees play a very important role as the watch dogs of Parliament. They help Parliament in ensuring financial control over executive. questions.Question: Under the citizenship act of 1955 the ways prescribed for acquiring citizenship are
questions.solution: Solution:		Under the citizenship act of 1955 the ways prescribed for acquiring citizenship are by birth, by descent, by registration, by naturalization and by incorporation of territory.

questions.Question: Which article declares that all laws that are inconsistent with or in derogation of any of the fundamental rights shall be void?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Article declares that laws before the commencement of the Constitution of India, 1950 that are inconsistent with the Part III – Fundamental Rights section of the Constitution as void. Also, Article 13 instructs the State to not make any law that violates the provisions under Part III.

questions.Question: The idea of Directive Principles of state policy in the constitution of India has been borrowed from
questions.solution: Solution:		The concept of Directive Principles of State Policy was borrowed from the Irish Constitution. The makers of the Constitution of India were influenced by the Irish nationalist movement, particularly the Irish Home Rule Movement.

questions.Question: Which act provides for the disqualification of members of the Parliament or State Legislature for indulging in corrupt practices?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Representation of the People Act, 1951 is an act of Parliament of India to provide for the conduct of election of the Houses of Parliament and to the House or Houses of the Legislature of each State, the qualifications and disqualifications for membership of those Houses, the corrupt practices and other offences at or in connection with such elections and the decision of doubts and disputes arising out of or in connection with such elections. questions.Question: The procedure for the amendment of the Constitution is laid down in:
questions.solution: Solution:		The procedure of amendment in the constitution is laid down in Part XX (Article 368) of the Constitution of India. This procedure ensures the sanctity of the Constitution of India and keeps a check on arbitrary power of the Parliament of India.

questions.solution: Solution:		Unitary furm of govt is a type of govt in which country is governed by a single unit of power i.e. central government which controls all the state affairs with a unified command.

questions.Question: ___ means that the Supreme Court will reconsider the case and the legal issues involved in it.
questions.solution: Solution:		In Appellate Jurisdiction, Supreme Court can reconsider the case, whose verdict is pronounced by subordinate court. Appellate jurisdiction covers criminal,civil and constitutional matters. Appellate Jurisdiction of Supreme Court can be extended by Parliament.

questions.Question: The Indian'Judiciary headed' by-
questions.solution: Solution:		Judicial system in India is unified and integrated. This unified system of courts was legacy of British rule introduced by Government of India Act, 1935. In this set up Supreme Court heads the Indian Judiciary as it is highest court of appeal in all cases and final interpreter of constitution.

questions.Question: Who was the first Woman Judge of the supreme court?
questions.solution: Solution:		Justice Fathima Beevi was first female judge to be appointed to Supreme Court of India in 1989. She was also the first Muslim woman to be appointed to any higher judiciary.

questions.Question: The Supreme Court of India has-
questions.solution: Solution:		Supreme Court of India has all the three i.e. Original,Appellate and Consultative or Advisory Jurisdiction. questions.Question: The Supreme Court of India was set up-
questions.solution: Solution:		Supreme Court of India was setup in 1950 by the Constitution under the provisions of Article-124(1) consisting of Chief Justice of India and 7 other judges in the beginning.

questions.Question: The Supreme Court is empowered to settle election disputes of President and Vice-President. This is its-

questions.solution: Solution:		Member of Legislative Assembly i.e. M.L.A. is a representative elected by voters of a constituency under state legislative assembly. Similarly the representatives in legislative council are called Member of Legislative Council i.e. M.L.C.

questions.solution: Solution:		Minimum age limit for membership of Vidhan Parishad or Legislative Council is 30 years. They have a fixed tenure of 6 years. questions.Question: What is the minimum age for becoming a Governor of state in India?
questions.solution: Solution:		Minimum age to become Governor of state is 35 years. Other eligibility criteria for Governor includes Indian citizenship and he/she must not hold any other office of profit. Governor do not need to be member of any house of state.

questions.Question: Who appoints Governor of a State in India?
questions.solution: Solution:		President of India appoints Governor of State in India for a term of 5 years. Governors are the constitutional head of state. Governor act on advice of Council of Ministers headed by Chief Minister.

questions.Question: The parliamentary form of government as prevalent in India emphasizes the interdependence between the:
questions.solution: Solution:		The parliamentary form of government as prevalent in India emphasizes the interdependence between the Legislative and Executive Organs.

questions.Question: The main duty of the Speaker Protem of Lok Sabha is :
questions.optionB: To administer oath to the new members
questions.solution: Solution:		Pro-tem speaker is mainly an operating and temporary speaker. To conduct the works in the centre or in state legislatives, pro-tem speaker is appointed for a limited time period. Generally in such a condition when the Lok Sabha and Legislative Assemblies have been elected, but the vote for the speaker and deputy speaker has not taken place, the pro-tem speaker is chosen. Pro-tem speaker is chosen with the agreement of the members of the Lok Sabha and legislative assembly, so that he can carry on the activities till the permanent speaker is not chosen.

questions.Question: How can a new All India Service be introduced-

questions.optionC: By passing a Resolution under Article-312

questions.Question: Who appoints the members of Union Public Service Commission-
questions.solution: Solution:		Under the provisions of Article-316, the Chairman and other members of a Public Service Commission shall be appointed, in the case of the Union Commission or a Joint Commission, by the President, and in the case of a State Commission, by the Governor of the State.

questions.Question: United Progressive Alliance was founded in?

questions.Question: The speaker of the Lok Sabha can ask a member of the house to stop speaking and let another member speak. This phenomenon is known as :
questions.solution: Solution:Yielding the floor. The speaker of the Lok sabha can ask a member of the house to stop speaking and let another member speak. Crossing the floor: Passing between the member addressing the House and the Chair which is considered breach of Parliamentary etiquette. Point of Order: A Member of Parliament may raise a point of order if he feels that the proceedings of' the House do not follow the normal rules. The presiding officer decides whether the point of order raised by the member should be allowed. Calling Attention Motion: With the prior permission of the Speaker, any member of the Parliament may call the attention of a Minister to a matter of urgent public importance. The Minister may make a brief statement about the matter or he may ask for time to make a statement later.

questions.Question: By which Constitutional Amendment Act was the number of Lok sabha seats increased from 525 to 545 ?

questions.Question: In our Constitution Economic planning is in-

questions.Question: The item 'Education' belongs to the-

questions.Question: The total number of Languages in 8th schedule of Indian Constitution are-

questions.Question: A writ of ____ means that the court orders that the arrested person should be presented before it.
questions.solution: Solution:		Habeas Corpus literally mean "that you have the body". The writ protects the person against any illegalimprisonment. It is applicable both against public and private bodies.

questions.Question: Which of the following writ's meaning is- "to have the body of"?
questions.solution: Solution:		Habeas Corpus literally means 'to have the body of' . questions.Question: When any House of Parliament (Lok Sabha or Rajya Sabha ) is adjourned without naming a day for reassembly it is known as :

questions.solution: Solution:Demand for Grants: Earmarking of budgetary allocation for meeting the plan and non-plan expenditure of a Ministry/Department. questions.Question: A governor, though he remains in office at the pleasure of the President is an integral part of :

questions.Question: Which articles of the Constitution of India explicitly confer the power of judicial review on a High Court ?

questions.Question: The Residuary powers of legislation under Indian Constitution rests with-
questions.solution: Solution:		As per seventh schedule of constitution,there are three lists which contain all legislative subjects. These areUnion list, State list and Concurrent list. Article 248 says, any subject, if not mentioned in above three lists, comes under residuary list which is completely under control of parliament.

questions.Question: How many schedules are in the constitution of India-
questions.solution: Solution:		At the time of commencement of constitution there were 8 Schedules. But at present, there are 12 Schedules in constitution of India. Newly added Schedules 9, 10, 11 and 12 are related to land reforms, anti-defection law, Panchayati Raj and Urban local bodies respectively.

questions.Question: How many subjects are there in union list-
questions.solution: Solution:		At the time of commencement of constitution Union list, State list and Concurrent list were comprised of 97,66 and 47 subject matters respectively. But at present, number of subject matters have changed in each list i.e.- Union list, state list and Concurrent list to 101, 61 and 52.

questions.Question: The Parliament can legislate on subjects given in the Union List only in consultation with the State Government for the State of-
questions.solution: Solution:		At the time of its integration into Indian union Jammu and Kashmir was given some special priviledges under Article-370. This established that any law made by parliament will be applicable in state of Jammu and Kashmir, only if it has got an approval of Government of Jammu and Kashmir.

questions.Question: "Bankruptcy and insolvency" is listed in the ______  list given in the Seventh Schedule in the Constitution of India.
questions.solution: Solution:		Bankruptcy and Insolvency are listed in 7th Schedule of the Constitution, The list encompasses 52 items including IPC, Criminal law procedure, Marriage and divorce, Trade union, Forests and Education.

questions.Question: Which of the follwing non-members of Parliament has the right to address it?
questions.solution: Solution:		Under the provisions of Article-88, Attorney General of India being the first law officer of country can be invited to Parliament for any suggestion or advice. He has the right to participate in the proceedings of both the houses of Parliament. He also has the right to speak but no right to vote in eighter house of Parliament.

questions.Question: What is the meaning of "Judicial Review" of Supreme Court-
questions.optionB: Review of the functioning of judiciary in country
questions.optionC: Review of constitutional validity of laws
questions.solution: Solution:		"Judicial Review" is power ofjudiciary to review the constitutional validity of any law made by legislature or act done by executive. It is also power of judiciary to declare a law invalid if it is inconsistent with constitutional provision.

President on a proposal passed by majority in
parliament
questions.optionC: Chief Minister in consultation with Governor
questions.optionD:
President in consultation with Chief Justice

questions.Question: Who appoits the judges of the Supreme Court of India?
questions.solution: Solution:		According to Article-124(2), judges of Supreme Court are appointed by President after consultation with such number of judges of Supreme Court and of High Courts as President may deem necessary and shall hold office till the age of 65 years. In appointment of a Judge other than Chief Justice, the Chief Justice of India shall always be consulted.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not an essential element of the state?
questions.solution: Solution:		State is a physical entity which has four essential elements. These are Sovereignty, Territory or land, Government, Population or Citizens. Any Sovereign state uses Government to bring control over its Territory and Citizens. Army is not an element of state, rather it is an institution which functions under control of Government.

questions.Question: The state operates through-
questions.solution: Solution:		State operates through government. Government is a set of institutions through which it exercises sovereign power over people and territory.

questions.Question: Indian Citizenship is granted by-

questions.Question: Formation of a new state in India is done by Citizenship-

The Parliament can proceed even if states have any reservation over formation of new states out of existing states.

questions.Question: The unification of Karnataka was achieved in the year-
questions.solution: Solution:		Unification of Karnataka refers to formation of Indian state of Karnataka from Princely State of Mysore by State Reorganisation Act, 1956. Earlier it was created by the name of Mysore which was later renamed to Karnataka in 1973.

questions.Question: Which of the following ensures grassroot democracy in India-
questions.solution: Solution:		The term Panchayati Raj in India signifies the system of rural local self government. It has been established in all states of India by Acts of State Legislatures to build democracy at grassroot level.

questions.Question: What is the structure of panchayati Raj?
questions.optionA:
Zilla Panchayat t Block Panchayat + Gram
Panchayat  Gram Sabha
questions.optionB:
Khap Panchayat + Zilla Panchayat t Block

Though Gram Sabha is not a tier of Panchayati Raj System, at village level it works as foundation stone of whole system of Panchayati Raj. It works as recommending body only.

questions.Question: Which of the followingis not an administrative function of a Village Panchayat?

These include providing sanitation and drainage, providing burial and cremation grounds, maintenance of roads, welfare of weaker sections, rural housing, fisheries etc. It also includes adult and non-formal education but does not include college education.

questions.Question: The Council of Ministers does not include-
questions.solution: Solution:		Article-75 establishes that there shall be a Council of Ministers headed by Prime Minister to aid and advice the President. questions.Question: The Attorney General of India has the power to appear in-

questions.Question: President can forward his resignation to whom?
questions.solution: Solution:		As mentioned under Article-56(1), President of India can resign from his office by writing a letter addressing to Vice-President. And as per Article-56(2), any resignation addressed to Vice-President shall be communicated to the Speaker of Lok Sabha.

questions.Question: The Vice-President is the ex-officio chaiman of-
questions.solution: Solution:		As mentioned under Article-64 and 89(1), Vice-President shall be the ex-officio Chairman of Rajya Sabha. Here ex-officio means that by virtue of one office you are authorized to hold another. And the moment you loose one office, you will loose the other one too.

questions.Question: The Ninth Schedule to the Indian constitution was added by-
questions.solution: Solution:		First constitutional amendment included Ninth Schedule in constitution of India, which provided that by incorporating any law into it, the state would make it immune from Judicial scrutiny. It provided for validation of certain acts and regulations, mostly relating to land reform.

questions.Question: Which one of the following schedules of the Indian Cotitution lists the names of states and specifies their territories?
questions.solution: Solution:		First Schedule lists the names of States and their territorial jurisdiction along with names of Union Territories and their extent. Second Schedule talks about provisions related to salaries and emoluments whereas third schedule talks about oath and affirmation of certainoffice bearers. questions.Question: Fundamental duties are included in the Indian Constitution by the Amendment-
questions.solution: Solution:		Article-51(A), under Part-IV(A) of constitution specifies fundamental duties of every citizen. These duties were added into constitution by 42nd Amendment Act of 1976 on recommendation of Sardar Swarn Singh committee.

questions.Question: When were the fundamental duties inserted in Indian constitution?

questions.Question: Who is the custodian of the implementation of the fundamental rights?
questions.solution: Solution:		Both Supreme Court and High Courts are custodian of implementation of fundamental rights. Supreme Court under Article-32 and High Courts under Article-226 issue writ for implementation of fundamental rights.

questions.Question: Which of the followings issues a writ?
questions.optionA: Any High Court and Supreme Court
questions.solution: Solution:		Both Supreme Court and High Courts have the power to issue writs under Article-32 and Article-226 respectively. Supreme Court can issue writs in case of violation of fundamental rights only but High court can issue writes in cases of violation of fundamental rights as well as legal rights.

questions.Question: What is the literal meaning of 'Certiorari'?
questions.optionD: To be certified (or) to be informed
questions.solution: Solution:		Certiorari means to be certified. The writ is issued by Supreme Court or any higher court to overturn the decision passed by any subordinate court tribunal or quasi-judicial authority.

questions.Question: "Persons may change but rules should not change" is the principle of-
questions.solution: Solution:		In constitutional government, the government functions under the provisions written in a document called constitution which sets out framework and principal functions of government. Here, the person who is leading the government may change but rules or provisions under constitution should not change.

questions.Question: In a federal Government the states enjoy-
questions.solution: Solution:		In federal form of government there iscomplete division of powers between center and states. Constitution is the guiding document which confers powers to state government and central government in this set up.

questions.Question: Which of the following is a feature of Presidential form of government?
questions.optionA: It protects the freedom of people
questions.optionB: It ensures the speedy execution of policies
questions.solution: Solution:		In presidential form of government, head of government leads an executive branch that is separate from legislative branch. There is a fix term for both executive and legislature which stabilizes the system. This form of government ensures speedy execution of policies along with protection of freedom of people.

questions.Question: The convention that "once a speaker always a speaker" is followed in-
questions.solution: Solution:		In UK, there is a convention that "once a speaker always a speaker". British speaker is elected at the beginning of parliament by and from among the members of House of Commons. If the speaker of outgoing Parliament is still a member of the house and is willing to be re-elected, he can do so. Usually, he is re-elected as many times as he wants. A changes pf party does not make any difference.

questions.Question: What is the full form of the Indian Political Party, "CPI"?

questions.Question:

questions.Question: What is a voluntary uion of sovereign and independent states called?

questions.Question: What kind of right is "Right to vote"-
questions.solution: Solution:		Constitution of India provides for right to vote under Article-326. According to this article, a person above the age of 18 years has the right to vote in elections in India. This right to vote is political in Nature.

questions.Question: What does the wheel in the National Flag represent?
questions.solution: Solution:		National Flag of India is a rectangular flag consisting of deep saffron, white and green colours with a 24 spoke wheel (the Ashok chakra) in navy blue at its centre. The wheelrepresents truth, justic and forwardness.

questions.Question: In the National Flag of India, Ashoka Chakra is a ____ spoked wheel.

questions.Question: Which of the following country has an Non-written constitution-
questions.solution: Solution:		Non-written constitution means no single document where all the laws are written. UK, New Zealand and Israel have non-written constitution.

questions.Question: Objective resolution was moved in constituent assembly by-
questions.solution: Solution:		Objective resolution was moved in constituent Assembly by Pt.Jawahar Lal Nehru on 13th December 1946 which ultimately became the preamble to the constitution of India. It set out main objectives which were intended to achieve by constituent assembly while formation of constitution.

questions.Question: What is the basis of classification of governments as unitary and federal?
questions.optionC: Relationship between the centre and states
questions.optionD:
Relationship between the legislature,
executive and judicial wings of government
questions.solution: Solution:		On the basis of distribution of powers between the centre and states, the government is classified into two Unitary and Federal government. In Unitary form of govt all powers are kept with center, some of which can be delegated to state whereas in federal government there is complete division of powers between center and state.

questions.Question: The governor of a state is empowered to grant pardons etc. and to suspend, remit or commute sentences in certain cases under:
questions.solution: Solution:		Power of Governor to grant pardons, etc, and to suspend, remit or commute sentences in certain cases The Governor of a State shall have the power to grant pardons, reprieves, respites or remissions of punishment or to suspend, remit or commute the sentence of any person convicted of any offence against any law relating to a matter to which the executive power of the State extends

questions.Question: The fifty schedule to the constitution of India deals with administration and control of :

questions.optionD: Provisions as to disqualification on ground of defection.

questions.Question: Article 360 to constitution of India deals with the provisions as to :
questions.solution: Solution:		Article 360 states that if the President is satisfied that a situation has arisen whereby the financial stability or the credit of India or any part thereof is threatened, President may declare a state of financial emergency.

questions.Question: The idea of Republic and the ideals of liberty, equality and fraternity as laid down in the preamble to the constitution of India have been borrowed from :
questions.solution: Solution:		The idea of Republic and the ideals of liberty, equality and fraternity as laid down in the preamble to the constitution of India have been borrowed from French constitution.

questions.Question: The provisions as covered by Article 343 to 351 under Part XVII of the constitution of India deals with
questions.solution: Solution:		The provisions as covered by Article 343 to 351 under Part XVII of the constitution of India deals with Official Language.

questions.Question: Which part of the Constitution of India deals with special provisions to SCs, STs, OBCs and Anglo-Indians ?

questions.Question: The Inter State Council was established in 1990 in pursuance of the recommendation made by :

questions.Question: Reservation for the Scheduled Castes andScheduled Tribes in the services has been provided in the Indian Constitution under-

questions.Question: Which of the following article of Indian constitution is related with the declaration of a welfare state?
questions.solution: Solution:		Article-36 to 51 under Part-IV of constitution provides for Directive Principles of State Policy. It is a set of philosophy to make India into a welfare state. Article-39 contains certain principles of policy which are to be followed by the state. These include adequate means of livelihood to men and women equally equal pay for equal work to both men and women and healthy environment for children to develop etc.

questions.Question: Which of the article ensures that Directive principles of state policy cannot be enforced by any court?
questions.solution: Solution:		Article-37 under Part-IV of the Indian Constitution talks about the application of the Directive Principles of State Policy. According to this article directives under Part-IV are non-enforceable by any court but they are fundamental in governance of the country. State should keep these principles in mind while formulating policies and enacting laws.

questions.Question: Article-39(A) of the Indian Constitution "Equal justice and free legal aid" deals with?
questions.optionB: the directive principles of state policy
questions.optionD: the fundamental rights of the Indian Citizen
questions.solution: Solution:		Article-39(A) which deals with Directive Principles of State Policy ensures "Equal justice and free legal aid" by the State to its citizens. 42nd Amendment act 1976 added this article into the constitution. According to this article State shall ensure that equal opportunities for securing justice are not denied to any citizen by reason of economic or other disability.

questions.Question: Which article of the Indian Constitution provides for the  institution of Panchayati Raj?
questions.solution: Solution:		Article-40 of the Indian constitution provides directive for the State to organise village panchayats and endow them with such powers to enable them to function as unitsof self government.

questions.Question: The president convenes and prorogues all sessions of Parliament in consultation with
questions.optionC: the prime minister and the leader of the Opposition in Lok Sabha
questions.solution: Solution:		The President convene and prorogue all sessions of Parliament in consultation with the Prime Minister.

questions.Question: The president can be impeached for

questions.Question: The name of the union given in the Constitution is
questions.solution: Solution:		The name of the union given in the Constitution is India or Bharat.

questions.Question: Answer the name of two temporary houses of parliamentary structure of India-

questions.Question: A motion that seeks to reduce the amount of demand presented by government to Rs. 1/- is known as-

Whereas Economy cut represents the grievance not against the policy but against the demand for grant and it seeks to reduce the amount of demand by a specific amount. Token cut is introduced to ventilate a specific grievance within the sphere of responsibiliy of Goverment and it is expressed by asking for reducing the amount of demand by Rs.100

questions.Question: Which of the following is a feature of civil services India-

questions.Question: Communist Party of India was founded in-
questions.solution: Solution:		Communist Party of India (CPI) was formed in 1925 in Kanpur and is mainly influencial in Kerala and West Bengal.

questions.solution: Solution:		A State Public Service Commission (SPSC) comprises of a chairman and other members appointed by the governor of the state. questions.Question: The president can assign any of the functions of the union government to the state government
questions.optionA: in consultation with the chief justice of India

questions.optionD: in consultation with the government of the state

questions.solution: Solution:		There are 12 schedules in the Constitution of India.

questions.Question: The number of parliamentary seats (Lok Sabha) of Haryana is-
questions.solution: Solution:		The parliamentary seats in Lok Sabha are allocated to States on the basis of population. It is taken care of that the difference between parliamentary seat or constituency with highest population and that with lowest population should not be more than 10%. Haryana has 10 representatives in Lok Sabha.

questions.Question: Indian Parliament is capable of making any law for any state, if-
questions.optionB: Two or more states request for that
questions.optionC: President sends a message to the Parliament
questions.solution: Solution:		There are certain circumstances when Parliament can make laws in state list for any state. These are - (1) Under Article-249, if Rajya Sabha passes resolution to such effect in supreme nation interest. (2) Under Article-250, during the proclamation of National Emergency as per Article-352. (3) Under Article-252, if two or more states request the union to make a common law. (4) Under Article-253, to fulfill international agreements or treaty signed by Union. questions.Question: There are total parliamentary seats (LokSabha constituency) in West Bengal-
questions.solution: Solution:		There are total 42 parliamentary seats of Lok Sabha in West Bengal. The normal tenure of Lok Sabha is five years. However,the House tan be dissolved on certain grounds. In constitution, strength of Lok Sabha should be not more than 552 - 530 from states and 20 from UT. Two members belonging to Anglo-Indian community can nominated by President.

questions.Question: There are total parliamentary seats (Rajya Sabha constituency) in Odisha-
questions.solution: Solution:		There are total of 10 parliamentary seats of Rajya Sabha in Odisha, The strength of Raja Sabha seats varies from state to stale and is based on population of a state. Total strenth of Rajya Sabha is 250 members. 1/3ed of member retire after every two years.

questions.Question: There are total parliamentary seats (Rajya Sabha constituency) in Tripura-
questions.solution: Solution:		There are total of parliamentary seat in Rajya Sabha for Tripura. Rajya Sabha seats are allocated to states on basis of population census. Uttar Pradesh has the highest number of Rajya Sabha seats. (Total 31 seats).

questions.Question: The Westminster parliamentary system was developed in-
questions.solution: Solution:		The westminster parliamentary system is a democratic system of government modelled after that of United Kingdom system, as used in the palace of Westminster, the location of the parliament of UK.

questions.Question: A big difference is there in between principle and behavior-
questions.solution: Solution:		There is always a big difference in between principle and behaviour in parliamentary form of government. In principle, President is executive head of state, but real repository of all executive powers is Prime Minister.

questions.Question: Where is the word "Federal" used in the constitution of India?
questions.solution: Solution:		Though India has federal system of governance,the word 'Federal' is nowhere mentioned in the constitution. Instead, Article-1, defins India as "Union of states" .

questions.Question: Indian Constitution is-
questions.solution: Solution:		Though Indian constitution has characteristics of federal structure, still it is called 'quasi-federal' in nature. This is because, in federal structure there is complete seperation of powers between center and states and center cannot interfere in affairs of state and vice-versa. Whereas in India there are provisions under which center can interfere in powers of state under few circumstances like national emergency, which makes it quasi-federal.

questions.Question: The president of India has the same constitution powers which have-
questions.solution: Solution:		Though president is the executive head of union, his powers are nominal. The real repository of all executie powers of union is Prime Minister. Same is the governance system in Britain where British Crown has same powers which President of India has.

questions.Question: Where the High Courts in India first set up?
questions.solution: Solution:		Madras High Court in Chennai, Bombay High Court in Mumbai, Calcutta High Court in Kolkata and Allahabad High Court in Allahabad are the oldest four High Courts in India. Among these Calcutta High Court is oldest which was established on 2nd July 1862 through Indian High Courts Act,1861.

questions.Question: _____ means cases that can be directly considered by the Supreme Cour't without going to the lower courts before that.
questions.solution: Solution:		Orginal jurisdiction or Supreme Court means the concerned parties can directly move to the Supreme Court without approaching the lower courts. Supreme Court original jurisdiction extends to any dispute between the Governmentof India and any state or states on one side and one or more states on other or between two or more states.

questions.Question: The power of mitigation of dispute between centre and state falls in ______ of the supreme court of India-
questions.solution: Solution:		Power to settle the dispute between Centre and states or dispute between two or more states falls under Original Jurisdiction of Supreme Court. Article-131 provides for Original Jurisdiction of Supreme Court. Original Jurisdiction of a court is power to hear the case for the first time and no other lower court can consider such cases.

questions.Question: The Supreme Court of India acts as a Federel Court when it deals with-
questions.solution: Solution:		Supreme Court has exclusive Original Jurisdiction over any dispute between Centre and States, or between two or more states i.e. inter-state disputes. In this capacity, it acts a Federal Court.

questions.Question: The interpreter of Indian constitution is-
questions.solution: Solution:		Supreme Court is custodian and final interpreter of constitution. It has the authority to interpret and elucidate the meaning and spirit of provisions under constitution in case of any ambiguity. This authority of Supreme Court can be derived from Article-132 and 133.

questions.Question: The 'Right to Vote' in elections of the parliament is a-
questions.solution: Solution:		Right to vote is alegalright. It is an universal adult suffrage which means every person who has attained the age of 18 years and is not barred by any law, has the right to caste his/her vote.

questions.Question: What is the meaning of 'Right to Vote'-
questions.optionA: To pass such laws which can punish people
questions.optionB:
Right to vote to elect a representative in
election
questions.solution: Solution:		Right to vote means to vote fopr electing a representative for democratic governance system. Initially the age to vote in elections in India was 21 years. But after 61st amendment of constitution, it was reduced to 18 years (enforced on 29 March 1989) as mentioned under Article-326.

questions.Question: "Liberty consists in obedience to the general will" whose statement is this-
questions.solution: Solution:		Rousseau said "Liberty consists in obedience to the general will". Liberty means according to one's wishes. It means not being subject to the will other person.

questions.Question: Whose statement is this "Man is born free but always in shackles"-
questions.solution: Solution:		Rousseau said "Man is born free but always in shackles". He intended to say that people deserve to be free but they are chained by societies in which they live. A society may legitimately coerce its people only when they agree to be ruled by that society.

questions.Question: Which of the following countries is governed by a King-

questions.Question: Which of the following language was given the status of "Classical language" by the central government-
questions.solution: Solution:		Currently there are six languages that enjoy the 'Classical' status in India: Tamil (declared in 2004), Sanskrit (2005), Kannada (2008), Telugu (2008), Malayalam (2013), and Odia (2014). Classical language is the official status accorded by Government of India. The onus to designate classical status rest upon the Ministry of Culture.

questions.Question: Who among the following supports customary rights?
questions.solution: Solution:		Customary rights are based on custom and traditional practices. Ritchie extended its support for customary rights. In India, forest dwellers and members of tribal and indigenous communities are entitled to enjoy their customary rights.

questions.Question: What is meant by 'defection'?
questions.solution: Solution:		Defection in politics implies switching the political parties after winning election. 10th Schedule of Constitution deals with Anti-defection law. 52th Amendment in Constitution is associated with defection of elected representatives.

questions.Question: The phrase 'procedure established by the law' means
questions.optionA: the judges in India cannot question the fairness or validity of a law, provided it is within the limits of the constitution
questions.optionB: judges in India can question the fairness or validity of an undue law even if it is within the limits of the constitution
questions.optionC: judges in India can declare a law invalid simply because in their opinion the law is not due or is unjust
questions.solution: Solution:		The phrase 'procedure established by the law' means the judges in India cannot question the fairness or validity of a law, provided it is within the limits of the constitution.

questions.Question: The national anthem was written by
questions.solution: Solution:		The national anthem was written by Rabindranath Tagore.

questions.Question: The member of a State Public Service Commission can be removed on the ground of misbehavior only after an enquiry has been conducted by the

questions.Question: The members of the standing committee are taken from the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha in the ratio of
questions.optionD: equal members for both the Houses
questions.solution: Solution:		The members of the standing committee are taken from the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha in the ratio of two and one respectively.

questions.Question: The preamble enshrines certain ideals that were first spelt out in
questions.optionA: the speech by Jawaharlal Nehru on the banks of Ravi when he called for Purana Swaraj
questions.optionC: a resolution adopted at the Karachi session of the Indian National Congress

questions.solution: Solution:		The preamble enshrines certain ideals that were first spelt out in the Objectives Resolution adopted by the Constituent Assembly.

questions.Question: Under which article, President of India can proclaim constitutional emergency?
questions.solution: Solution:		Under Article-356 of the contitution, President if satisfied that state government is not carried out in accordance with the law, can declare constitutional emergency in state. The article was first time used in Punjab in 1954.

questions.Question: Which period below depicts internal emergency in India under article 352?
questions.solution: Solution:		Under the provisions of Article-352, National Emergency was declared for internal disturbance from the period of 25th June, 1975 to 21th March, 1977 by the then President Fakhruddin Ali Ahmad during the Prime Ministership of Indira Gandhi.

questions.Question: Under which Article was Emergency in India declared in 1975?
questions.solution: Solution:		Under the provisions of Article-352, National Emergency was declared for internal disturbance from the period of 25th June, 1975 to 21th March, 1977 by the then President Fakhruddin Ali Ahmad during the Prime Ministership of Indira Gandhi.

questions.Question: At the time of emergency in 1975, who was serving as the President of India?

questions.Question: In India, which kind of emergency has been imposed only once-
questions.solution: Solution:		While the proclamations of National Emergency in 1962 and 1971 were made on the ground of "External aggression", the third proclamation of emergency was made on the ground of "Internal disturbance" in 1975. Financial Emergency has never been imposed whereas President's rule has been imposed more than a hundred times.

questions.Question:

questions.Question: The declaration that Democracy is a Government of the people, by the people for the people was made by-
questions.solution: Solution:		16th President of U.S.A. Abraham Lincoln defined democracy as government of the people, by the people and for the people.

questions.solution: Solution:		A Federal structure for India was first put forward in Government of India Act of 1935. The act divided the powers between centre and provinces in terms of three lists namely Federal list, Provincial list and the Concurrent list. Residuary powers were vested with Viceroy.

questions.Question: The Advantage of unitary system of governance is-
questions.solution: Solution:		A unitary form of government is a government in which all powers of state are concentrated in hands of central government. Under this sytem administration becomes strong as all the powers are in hands of one government and greater skill and efficiency is reflected both in domestic and international affairs.

questions.Question: In which of the form, composit India has been described in the constitution?
questions.solution: Solution:		Article 1 says, "India, that is Bharat, shall be a union of states." questions.Question: Which of these languages is generally not spoken in Southern part of India?
questions.solution: Solution:		Maithili is a language spoken in Mithila region which is present day Bihar. Telugu, Konkani and Malayalam are languages spoken in Southern part of India, in states of Andhrara Pradesh, Goa and Kerala respectively.

questions.Question: Malayalam is the official language of-
questions.solution: Solution:		Malayalam along with English is official language of Lakshadweep. questions.Question: Marathi is the official language of-
questions.solution: Solution:		Marathi is the official language of Dadra and Nager Haveli along with Gujarati and Hindi. Delhi and Chandigarh have Hindi and English respectively as its official languages. Daman and Diu has Gujarati along with Konkani and Hindi as its official language.

questions.Question: Konkani is the official language of -

questions.Question: Who approves a bill as money bill in Lok Sabha-
questions.solution: Solution:		According to the provisions under Articlel-110(3), Speaker of Lok Sabha has the power to approve a bill as money bill. And if there arises any question over the validity of a money bill, the decision of the Speaker of Lok Sabha is final and it cannot be questioned even in the court of law.

questions.Question: The discussion on any matter of urgent public importance, presented by any member of house is known as-
questions.solution: Solution:		Adjournment motion is introduced to draw attention of the house to a specific matter of urgent public importance. It can be introduced only in Lok Sabha and needs the support of 50 members to get admitted.

questions.Question: The number of parliamentary seats (Lok Sabha) of Andhra Pradesh is -
questions.solution: Solution:		Andhra Pradesh which was formed as first linguistic state in India, has representation of 25 seats in Lok Sabha. In Rajya Sabha it has representation of 11 seats.

questions.Question: In India, no government expenditure can be made without approval of -
questions.solution: Solution:		Appropriation bill under Article-114, is passed during the budgetary process in Parliament. This bill consists of demand for grant of all ministeries and departments. Passage of this bill authorizes expenditure from Consolidated Fund of India. Government will not be in a position to make any expenditure unless Appropriation bill has been passed by Parliament.

questions.Question: _______can give the Union parliament power to make lawson matters included in the State list.
questions.optionC: Securities and Exchange Board of India
questions.solution: Solution:		Article-249 of Indian Constitution provides that if Rajya Sabha passes a resoultion by 2/3rd majority which necessiates that there is a need to make law on any national importance then Parliament can make laws in this regard.

questions.Question: Which constitutional Amendment Act facilitates the appointment of the same person as a governor for two or more states?
questions.solution: Solution:		7th constitutional Amendment Act, 1956 facilitates the appointment of the same person as a governor for two or more states.

questions.Question: Which Article of the constitution empowers the High court to issue writs including habeas corpus, mandamus, certiorari, prohibition and quo warranto for the enforcement of fundamental rights of the citizens and for any other purpose ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Article 226 empowers the High court to issue writs including habeas corpus, mandamus, certiorari, prohibition and quo warranto for the enforcement of fundamental rights of the citizens and for any other purpose.

questions.Question: To be eligible as Vice-president a person should have completed:
questions.solution: Solution:		To be eligible as Vice-president a person should have completed 35 years of age.

questions.Question: The pardoning power of the president in India as enshrined in the Article 72 of the constitution of India includes :
questions.solution: Solution:		The pardoning power of the president in India as enshrined in the Article 72 of the constitution of India includes pardon, commutation, remission, respite, reprieve.

questions.Question: Under which article of the constitution does the governor of state possess the pardoning power?
questions.solution: Solution:		Under article 161 of the constitution the governor of state possess the pardoning power.

questions.Question: In parliamentary democracy "he is the first among all". Who is he-
questions.solution: Solution:		Prime Minister is the chief crisis manager of the country. According to Lord Morley, head of the Government in parliamentary form of government i.e. Prime Minister is "Primus Inter Pares", meaning, "first among all of his equals". The kind of authority which is enjoyed by Prime Minister in parliamentary form of government is immense and can never be equated even with the authority of all the members of Council of Minister put together.

questions.Question: Which of the following does not hold his post after the approval of the President?
questions.solution: Solution:		Prime Minister of India, Governor of State and Election Commissioners in India, all are appointed by President or hold his post after approval of President. Whereas there is no need ef approval of President in case of appointment of Speaker of Lok Sabha as he or she is elected by the members Lok Sabha from among themselves.

questions.Question: The winning candidate in the Election of President of India should secure-
questions.optionB: Sixty six percent of votes polled
questions.optionD:
More than fifty percent and majority of the
total votes polled
questions.solution: Solution:		Provisions dealing with election of President are provided in Articles-54 and 55 and President and Vice President (elections) Act,1952. Accordingly, President ofIndia is elected through Proportional Representation by Means of Single Transferable Vote system. The winning candidate in this method of election must secure more than 50 percent of total valid votes.

questions.Question: Rashtrapati Bhavan was built in-
questions.solution: Solution:		Rashtrapati Bhawan, formerly known as Viceroy's House, is the official residence of President of India located in New Delhi. Its architect was Edwin Landseer Lutyens. Its construction started in 1912 and it was completed in 1929 during the Viceroyality of Lord Irwin.

questions.Question: Which of the following can bring the impeachment process of Vice-President?
questions.solution: Solution:		Removal of Vice President is a special power of Rajya Sabha. Article-67 provides for the procedure of removal of Vice President. A resolution seeking removal of Vice President can only be brought first in Rajya Sabha. And it must be approved by a majority of all the then members of Rajya Saba and must be agreed by Lok Sabha with simple majority.

questions.Question: The Committee appointed in 1977 to review working of the Panchayati Raj was chaired by-
questions.solution: Solution:		In December 1977, the Janata Party Government appointed a committee to review working of Panchayati Raj under Chairmanship of Ashok Mehta. It proposed for two tier Panchayati Raj System which included Zila Parishad at district level and Mandai Panchayat (villages with population of 15,000-20,000).

questions.Question: The 3-tier of the Panchayati Raj System consists of-
questions.optionA:
Gram Sabha, Anchal Panchayat, Panchayat
Samiti

Janapad Panchayat, Taluka Panchayat,
Anchal Panchayat
questions.optionC:
Gram Panchayat,Block and Panchayat
Samiti, Zilla Parishad

questions.solution: Solution:		India has adopted for 3-tier Panchayati Raj System. These are Gram Panchayat at village level, Block Panchayat or Panchayat Samiti at intermediate or block level, Zila Parishad at district level.

questions.Question: What is the system of Local Self Government in the Panchayati Raj set up?
questions.optionA:
Four tier system at the village, block, district
and State level
questions.optionB:
Three tier structure at village, block and
district level
questions.optionC: Two tier system at village and block level
questions.optionD: Single tier set up at village level
questions.solution: Solution:		India has adopted for 3-tier Panchayati Raj System. These are Gram Panchayat at village level, Block Panchayat or Panchayat Samiti at intermediate or block level, Zila Parishad at district level.

questions.Question: Panchayati Raj system has an Intermediate tier known as-
questions.solution: Solution:		India has adopted for 3-tier Panchayati Raj System. These are Gram Panchayat at village level, Block Panchayat or Panchayat Samiti at intermediate or block level, Zila Parishad at district level.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not a matter of Local Government?
questions.solution: Solution:		Local government includes Panchayati RaJ Institution and Urban Local Bodies in India. 73rd and 74th Constitutional amendment has accorded some functional matters to Panchayats and Urban Local Bodies respectively. These functional items include Fisheries, Public health, Cleanliness, Public utility services, Cultural activities, Minor forest produce etc. Law and order is a subject under state list which is being managed bY statE government and not by local government.

questions.Question: Who described Constitution of India as 'quasi-federal'?
questions.solution: Solution:		K.C.Wheare described Constitution of India as 'Quasi-federal'. Quasi-federal set up is a Federal system with inclination towards Unitary system. In this setup Centre can interfere in State matters during certain circumstances unlike in federal set up.

questions.Question: The "Rule of law" is the speciality of which of the following-
questions.solution: Solution:		Lord Dicey popularised the concept of Rule of law in Britain. Rule of law means 'law is supreme' and 'no one is above the law'. In India, constitution is supreme of law of land.

questions.Question: Who among the following proposed the suggestion for a Constituent Assembly first in 1935?
questions.solution: Solution:		M.N.Roy for the first time in 1934 came up with the idea of constituent assembly which became official demand of India National congress in 1935. And thisdemand for constituent assembly was first accepted by Britishers in August Offer of 1940.

questions.Question: Which of the following exercised the most profound inference in framing of Indian constitution?
questions.solution: Solution:		Most profound influence in framing constitution was exercised by GOI Act, 1935. Majority of provisions in constitution have been adopted from GOI Act, 1935. Federal scheme, office of governor, power of federal, Judiciary, emergency powers etc. were drawn from this act.

questions.Question:
Fundamental Rights of Indian constitution have been adopted from which of the following
nation-

questions.Question: Indian National Congress is a part of which political group?
questions.solution: Solution:		Indian National Congress is part of United Progressive Alliance (UPA) which was formed after 2004, general election in India. Sonia Gandhi, who is Chairman, of Indian National Congress, is also the Chairman of UPA.

questions.Question: Since Independence, India has been ruled by the Indian National Congress for how many years?
questions.solution: Solution:		Indian National Congress which is the oldest political party in India (since 1885), has ruled the India for 49 years since independence. Currently, the country is ruled by National Democratic Alliance lead by Bhartiya Janta Party.

questions.Question: The states of India are demanding more autonomy than centre in the areas of-
questions.solution: Solution:		Indian states are demanding more legislative, administrative and financial autonomy from Centre. Sarkaria commission also suggested measures to grant more autonomy to state.

questions.Question:
Which of the following is not a good argument in favour of democracy?

II. Democracies are more prosperous than others
